dialogue:
#Person1#: Hi Tom, are you busy tomorrow‚Äôs afternoon?
#Person2#: I‚Äôm pretty sure I am. What‚Äôs up?
#Person1#: Can you go with me to the animal shelter?.
#Person2#: What do you want to do?
#Person1#: I want to get a puppy for my son.
#Person2#: That will make him so happy.
#Person1#: Yeah, we‚Äôve discussed it many times. I think he‚Äôs ready now.
#Person2#: That‚Äôs good. Raising a dog is a tough issue. Like having a baby;-)
#Person1#: I'll get him one of those little dogs.
#Person2#: One that won't grow up too big;-)
#Person1#: And eat too much;-))
#Person2#: Do you know which one he would like?
#Person1#: Oh, yes, I took him there last Monday. He showed me one that he really liked.
#Person2#: I bet you had to drag him away.
#Person1#: He wanted to take it home right away;-).
#Person2#: I wonder what he'll name it.
#Person1#: He said he‚Äôd name it after his dead hamster ‚Äì Lemmy - he's a great Motorhead fan[HAPPY]))
summary: #Person1# will go to the animal shelter tomorrow to get #Person1# puppy for her son. They already visited the shelter last Monday and the son chose the puppy.

dialogue:
#Person1#: I‚Äôve just fallen in love with this advent calendar! Awesome! I wanna one for my kids!
#Person2#: I used to get one every year as a child! Loved them!
#Person1#: Yeah, i remember! they were filled with chocolates!
#Person3#: they are different these days! much more sophisticated! Haha!
#Person2#: yeah, they can be fabric/ wooden, shop bought/ homemade, filled with various stuff
#Person1#: what do you fit inside?
#Person3#: small toys, Christmas decorations, creative stuff, hair bands & clips, stickers, pencils & rubbers, small puzzles, sweets
#Person1#: WOW! That‚Äôs brill! X
#Person3#: i add one more very special thing as well- little notes asking my children to do something nice for someone else
#Person2#: i like that! My sister adds notes asking her kids questions about christmas such as What did the 3 wise men bring? etc
#Person3#: i reckon it prepares them for Christmas
#Person1#: and makes it more about traditions and being kind to other people
#Person3#: my children get very excited every time they get one!
#Person1#: i can see why![HAPPY]
summary: #Person1# and #Person2# love the advent calendar. #Person3# fits inside calendar various items, for instance, small toys and Christmas decorations. Her children are excited whenever they get the calendar.

dialogue:
#Person1#: Madison is pregnant
#Person1#: but she doesn't wanna talk about it
#Person2#: why
#Person1#: I don't know why because she doesn't wanna talk about it
#Person2#: ok
#Person1#: I wanted to prepare you for it because people get super excited and ask lots of questions
#Person1#: and she looked way more anxious than excited
#Person2#: she's probably worrying about it
#Person2#: she's taking every commitment really seriously
#Person1#: it could be money problems or relationship problems
#Person2#: or maybe she wants an abortion
#Person1#: it could be all of the above
#Person2#: but you know what?
#Person2#: once my friend was pregnant and I couldn't bring myself to be happy about it
#Person1#: why?
#Person2#: I felt they were immature and I couldn't picture this couple as parents
#Person1#: I felt similar way on Patricia's wedding
#Person2#: Patricia Stevens?
#Person1#: yes
#Person2#: so we're talking about the same person
#Person1#: what a coincidence
#Person1#: so she's pregnant?
#Person2#: she thought she was
#Person1#: damn...
summary: Madison is pregnant but she doesn't want to talk about it. Patricia Stevens got married and she thought she was pregnant.

dialogue:

dialogue:
#Person1#: Howdy, how y'all doin'?
#Person2#: Is that a Texan drawl, girl?
#Person1#: Yes ma'am! Loving it out here!
#Person2#: How's the job going? Kids behaving themselves?
#Person1#: Mostly! They laugh at my accent though!
#Person2#: Well, they probably haven't met a Welsh person before!
#Person1#: No shit! They ask me to repeat everything! Best one is "Water", course, it's mostly "Waarderr" here!
#Person2#: LOL. I'd love to hear that, you picked up the accent yet?
#Person1#: Nah, 21 years in Cardiff isn't easily removed!
#Person2#: We're missing you here, the pub is quiet these days without your laugh!
#Person1#: Miss you too! I'm coming home in 6 weeks, though. Last fortnight I'm going travelling with 3 other Brits working here, a Geordie girl, a guy from Belfast and Annie, who's from Glasgow.
#Person2#: My God, I'm so jealous! I bet they had even more trouble being understood out there! See you after your trip!
summary: #Person1#'s working in Texas, but the kids laugh at her Welsh accent. She's coming home in 6 weeks. Earlier than that she's going to travel with 3 other Brits.

dialogue:
#Person1#: Hello Michael, thank you for your invitation, I am currently unavailable for contracting so I have included my wonderful friend and colleague, Laura, in the conversation. I believe she might be able to help you out!
#Person2#: Thank you, Sally, for your kind response, it's a shame you won't be able to join us but thank you for the recommendation, much appreciated.
#Person3#: Hello Sally, hello Michael![HAPPY] Thank you for the invitation, I am very honoured to be in such a respectable company!
#Person1#: My pleasure, absolutely! Michael, Laura has extensive experience and fantastic work ethics, I'm sure the two of you will cooperate splendidly!
#Person3#: Thank you, Sally, for your kind words. Michael, I am indeed interested in your project. I would love to hear about it.
#Person2#: I'm sure Sally has already shared a great deal with you so you probably know what to expect. I have no doubts somebody she recommends is worth our attention.
#Person3#: Thank you, I have been incredibly lucky to have worked with Sally and learn from her vast experience and unmatched professionalism. Would we need to meet in person to discuss further details?
#Person1#: Michael, if need be, I will be happy to join your meeting, be it in person or via skype.
summary: #Person1# is unavailable for contracting but recommends #Person3#. #Person2# appreciates it. #Person3# wants to meet to discuss further details.

dialogue:
#Person1#: Who wants to go out for a drink?
#Person2#: No, sorry, I'm cleaning the house today.
#Person3#: You've always loved cleaning, haven't you? I remember how angry you used to get with your brother for leaving a mess in the kitchen.
#Person4#: Yeah, she'd always yell at me, even though I was the one in charge when our parents were away.
#Person1#: I don't get why it matters so much whether I clean my flat once a week or once a month. No one died from a bit of dust.
#Person2#: Remind me to never stay at your place:P
#Person3#: I'm somewhere in between. My house is always a mess, but I hate it when it's dirty.
#Person4#: What's the difference?
#Person3#: I can't stand when there's dust, crumbs on the floor etc., so I clean regularly. But I love it when all my stuff just lies around. When I put everything back on shelves or into cabinets, I keep on getting mad that I have to look for it, get up and take it out, and generally lose so much time. I like to have everything within my reach.
#Person4#: There's no better wardrobe than the armchair, right? [LAUGH]
#Person1#: I prefer the floor. There's more space on it[LAUGH]
#Person2#: Just reading this gives me the creeps.
#Person1#: Fine, go back to cleaning, we'll think of you while sharing a beer[LAUGH]
#Person3#: Hey, I never said I can come. My hubby's away this weekend, so I have no one to leave the kids with;(
#Person4#: Take them to Megan's place, they can help her clean[LAUGH]
#Person2#: You know what? I don't care. I can watch your kids, Roseanne. Just bring them over.
#Person3#: But are you serious or just mad at us?
#Person2#: No, I'm serious. I like your kids. And they're nice enough that if I ask them to do something, they actually do it[LAUGH]
#Person3#: LOL, okay. Actually, I think that when I tell them to go and help aunt Meg with cleaning, they'll think it's fun.
#Person4#: And when you tell them to clean their own rooms, they say you're a monster?[LAUGH]
#Person3#: Exactly. But Bill for example always cleans the windows at my parents house. They don't even need to ask anymore, he simply knows it's his job.
#Person1#: Do they pay him?:P
#Person3#: Well, sometimes. But still I think he likes doing it. I don't know, maybe it's because no one checks if he did it well, he's just left alone to do his thing, so he feels like a man in the house in a way?
#Person2#: Tell them I can pay with cookies if they help me.
#Person3#: The famous chocolate cookies?
#Person2#: Why not? I'm feeling generous today[LAUGH]
#Person3#: Guys, I think I'm gonna change my mind about that beer. Meg, would you accept one more helper?[LAUGH]
#Person2#: You're always welcome! But sorry boys, it's going to be a ‚Äúgirls only‚Äù event (except for little Billy). Otherwise my house will never get cleaned today[LAUGH]
summary: #Person3# wanted to go out for a beer with #Person1# and #Person4#, and leave her kids with #Person2#. #Person2# will clean the house and give #Person3#'s kids her famous chocolate cookies if they help, what made #Person3# change her mind, and she wants to join them.

dialogue:
#Person1#: Hey, are you busy this Friday?

#Person2#: And? Aren't you afraid?
#Person1#: A bit, yes, but I always wanted to learn horse riding, so I thought that as soon as it isn't anything that requires me to, I don't know, go abroad or a lot of money, I may at least give it a try.
#Person2#: Makes sense. I'm just worried[WINK]
#Person1#: I know <3 Pity though as I wanted you to join me:>...

dialogue:
#Person1#: Hello, my name is Isabel, I have received your reservation. I'd like to confirm the details. Please send me a message whenever you are able to confirm your arrival.
#Person2#: Hi Isabel, thank you for your message, please tell me what kind of information do you need
#Person1#: First of all, I need full names of all guests
#Person1#: And your passport of ID numbers. I mean the document you are travelling with
#Person2#: No problem, I will send you photos of our passports this afternoon
#Person1#: Thank you. Full names and numbers will be enough for me, I don't think it's safe to send such dcuments by whatsapp
#Person2#: I think you're right... OK, let me just ask my friends and I will let you know this afternoon. Is it ok?
#Person1#: Yes, of course. What time are you arriving in Madrid?
#Person2#: 21:20 at barajas airport
#Person1#: Please let me know when you arrive. The best way to get to the apartment is to take the metro line 8 to the center, then change to line 10 at Nuevos Ministerios, and then line 1 at Tribunal. Your station is Ant√≥n Martin. You can call me if you need help.
#Person2#: Thank you Isabel! How much time do we need to get to the apartment?
#Person1#: I think that about 30 minutes.
#Person2#: We will have to wait for the luggage and get to the station but I really hope we arrive to the center around 22:00...
#Person1#: No problem, I will be waiting for you with the keys, I live next door[HAPPY]
#Person1#: Door 14
#Person2#: That's great, I will text you when we are at Anton Martin
#Person1#: Please tell me how many towels do you need. I will prepare 4 towels in the apartment but you can tell me if you need more.
#Person2#: Thank you, we will let you know
summary: #Person2# made a reservation with #Person1# and he needs to send her passport details of the guests. Cristian arrives in Madrid at 21:20. It takes 30 minutes to go from the barajas airport to the apartment by metro. The end station is Ant√≥n Martin. #Person1# lives next door, at number 14.

dialogue:
#Person1#: So it seems like we're finally getting ourselves a car.
#Person2#: Whoa, for real? Sweet, I know you've wanted one for a while. What make?
#Person1#: Oh, a Toyota. It'll be sooo much more convenient now. Our place isn't really that easy to reach by public transport, there's only one bus and it's like the timetable doesn't exist so you often end up waiting at the stop for ages.
#Person2#: Oh man, I remember it used to be like this. I thought things might've changed since the times I used to take the bus to visit you, but I guess not?
#Person1#: Yeah, sadly... but whatever. Now we won't have to rely on them any more, woohoo!
#Person2#: Must have been hard to convince Sylvia, no?
#Person1#: She was against it at first but I knew she had to give in eventually. I mean, it'll benefit all of us, after all.
#Person2#: Man, you'll be so happy, I'm sure. I know I don't regret it. Nothing beats the comfort and freedom, really.
#Person1#: Yeah, I'm trying to convince her to get a licence, too. I don't want her to feel like I'm only doing this for myself. It would be better if both of us could drive.
summary: #Person1# and Sylvia are getting a Toyota, because they are fed up with public transport. Sylvia was against it at first but she gave in. #Person1# wants her to get a licence so that they both can drive.

dialogue:
#Person1#: I think I should stop reading the rules after we already played a game
#Person1#: found two things we were doing wrong today
#Person2#: maybe it shows that you should keep reading them
#Person2#: so what we were doing wrong?
#Person1#: first the basic follow-up only gives you temp influence and not the permanent one (so my whole strategy for the day was basically based on a wrong rule:P)
#Person1#: and second, you only get the income for the resources you own (tokens on top) and not for everything you have access to
#Person2#: the map had full symbol drawn for the action so I also thought it was permanent influence
#Person2#: had no idea about the second one
#Person3#: the second rule means money would be much more sparse
#Person1#: well yes but it gives you a reason to build an already existing building again
#Person1#: with the rules we played with there was no sense in doing that
#Person3#: true
#Person3#: yet another game we need to play again with the right rules[WINK]
#Person1#: additionally during the vote phase, if there is a draw the first decision is taken by the player with the least amount of points and not the closest to the player initiating the vote
#Person2#: makes sense
#Person2#: but I'm not sure about the income phase, it's written that you get income for import
#Person4#: well yes but technically the import action is building your own buildings
#Person1#: so no matter how you look at it with import you'll always be on top with your token and get the income
#Person2#: right
#Person2#: well just like Emily said we need to play this again
#Person3#: we can always do it during the next meeting
#Person1#: as usual I'm up for anything
#Person1#: but if we'll play a new game, let me read the rules first:P
summary: #Person1# found out that they misunderstood the rules of the game. #Person3# and #Person2# think they should play the game again.

dialogue:
#Person1#: so how's the new affair going?[WINK]
#Person2#: hmm
#Person1#: what happened?
#Person2#: I'm not sure. I mean everything is fine but there's no chemistry. Maybe there's something wrong with me
#Person1#: There's nothing wrong with you. Don't let yourself think that. Maybe you just need more time
#Person2#: It's not like I wanna give up but sometimes I wonder if I should be forcing myself
#Person1#: Definitely not. But maybe try not to put so much pressure on it
#Person2#: I just don't understand it. And myself
#Person1#: You don't have to understand anything[HAPPY]
#Person2#: I mean there was definitely a spark at the beginning and now I really don't know what happened and how to get it back
#Person1#: You probably started thinking too much[WINK]
#Person2#: Hahah probably. My head is my worst enemy
#Person1#: You just met, don't force it. Why would you want chemistry that just dies out after 3 months? Maybe deep down you're looking for something more serious or stable and that's why you actually don't wanna rush it? And you're older now. It's more difficult to fall madly in love when you are not so easily fooled anymore[WINK]
#Person2#: I get it. It's not even about falling in love. I just don't get what happened. I mean I can't be in a relationship with absolutely no chemistry at all
#Person1#: Well it went away so maybe it will come back[LAUGH] You can't overthink those things. They don't like it[WINK]
#Person2#: I probably am overthinking. We had a heart to heart and I feel much better after the talk
#Person1#: You want soulmates, intellectual connection, and chemistry - that's some high expectations for a new relation. Not everything at once
#Person2#: Yeah I would but I know I can't have it all
#Person1#: Of course you can. But some things work better overtime. On the other hand, do NOT force yourself into anything.
#Person2#: I'm not going to. I guess I've been lucky I found someone who is understanding and wants to discuss things
#Person1#: Exactly. And once you feel safer, chemistry might come back, because you won't be analyzing and thinking and worrying and pressuring yourself[WINK]
#Person2#: You're probably right.
summary: #Person2# doesn't feel the chemistry in her new relationship anymore. #Person1# suggests that #Person2# is overthinking the situation and that #Person2# should give the relationship some time.

#Person1#: No. I am single again. Hurray! So pls make it single occupancy any week in January, Anton.

#Person2#: Take care!

dialogue:
#Person1#: Good evening, Professor, I apologize for writing to you on Facebook but I thought that it would be the easiest and quickest way to contact you. I would like to ask if there have been any news about tomorrow's classes. Everyone is wondering whether they should come to the university tomorrow or not. Thank you in advance for any information. Kind regards, Alice
#Person2#: Good evening, all classes will take place according to schedule tomorrow, so no good news for the students![HAPPY] By the way, I would really prefer if students wrote to me on my email address.
#Person1#: I know, I apologize
#Person2#: Ok, just remember in the future.
#Person1#: It's just we got used to communicating with Dr. Smith via Facebook, he uses it all the time
#Person2#: I know, Dr. Smith has a very informal approach, however I happen not to share his views.
#Person1#: Ok, sorry again, Professor!
#Person2#: You know I only answered here because you are older than your fellow students, had it been one of the others I would have told the rascal to send me a proper email message.[WINK]
#Person1#: I know, I apologize once again
#Person2#: No problem, see you tomorrow!
#Person1#: Have a nice evening
#Person2#: You too.
#Person1#: Oh and may I ask you one more thing?
#Person2#: I feel like I'm being forcibly Dr. Smith-ized here.
#Person1#: Sorry again...
#Person2#: Ok, ok, just ask.
#Person1#: May I ask you if you have read the second chapter of my thesis? I hope it's good but I'm not sure...
#Person2#: I haven't read all of it yet but it's pretty good so far. I will send you more feedback over the weekend, ok?
#Person1#: Ok, thank you very much, Professor!
#Person2#: You're welcome, just use email next time, please.
#Person1#: I will! Kind regards
#Person2#: That sounded strange in a messenger chat, but ok. Yours faithfully!
#Person1#: Good night, Professor[HAPPY]
#Person2#: Good night, Alice!
summary: #Person2# is going to teach her classes tomorrow according to schedule. #Person2# prefers that students write her messages on her e-mail address instead of Facebook. #Person2# hasn't read the whole 2nd chapter of #Person1#'s thesis yet, but thinks it's good so far.

But other people can grow bacteria on petri dishes if they're doing Microbiology, or study particular fragments of DNA if they're doing Genetics

#Person1#: Thanks love, I don't know what I'd do without you!

dialogue:
#Person1#: Hi Wanda, how is Uni going?
#Person2#: Pretty well, but the deadlines are doing my head in, so much fucking work!
#Person1#: I see you've started swearing like a typical student! My language got really bad last year!
#Person2#: Yeah, I remember! I was shocked, but everyone does it here!
#Person1#: Here too, only with Scottish accent as well, it did take me a few months to get used to it!
#Person2#: You're a lot braver than me, I only went about 15 miles to Leeds.
#Person1#: Yep, you didn't move out of West Yorks even!
#Person2#: Well, I prefer it! I can even go and work in the petrol station till 10pm and pop home on the late train if I want to, saves me food money to have a day or two of home cooking, plus it's a lot nicer.
#Person1#: I know what you mean! I can't be arsed to peel veg and stuff like that, I exist on take aways and convenience micro meals, not good!
#Person2#: Have you got I to the famous Scottish deep fried Mars bar craze?
#Person1#: ü§£I have had one, but Edinburgh is a bit posher than Glasgow where it's more popular. Do like square sausage and cloutie dumpling, though!
#Person2#: You'll have to initiate me into these delicacies when I come visit.
#Person1#: You bet! When can you make it?
#Person2#: Well, I have two days off lectures at the end of next week and I can swap my shifts around if I do it tomorrow. I reckon I can train it up next Thurs if that suits you.
#Person1#: Should be fine! I have got lectures Friday mind, you could try a bit of sightseeing, perhaps?
#Person2#: I would love to see the Castle and the National Art Gallery, have a wee look round too, hen!
#Person1#: Don't start trying to act all Scottish, you sassenach!
#Person2#: Not sure what that means, but you're a Yorkshire lass too and you do it!
#Person1#: Yes, but I'm an adopted Scottish person now. I'd really like to stay on here, maybe do a PGCE.
#Person2#: You a teacher! You haven't got the bloody patience to deal with kids all day!
#Person1#: Maybe, but it's an idea I've been toying with, convey my passion for history to the young!
#Person2#: Hopefully, the young will share your enthusiasm!
#Person1#: Well, we'll see, still got over a year to decide!
#Person2#: Think about it carefully, my sister teaches Geography over in Brighouse, as you know. She's only been doing it 3 years and she feels burnt out at the end of term!
#Person1#: Oh yeah, forgot about that! Anyway, keep me posted about next weekend, can't wait to see you if you can manage it!
#Person2#: Me too, bye Chuck!
#Person1#: Bye üòó!
summary: #Person2#'s uni is going pretty well. She studies in Leeds. She's going to visit #Person1# next Thursday. #Person1# is considering becoming a history teacher.

dialogue:
#Person1#: How are you? Any new development about the house?
#Person2#: Hello my dear! Sadly not. No news at all regarding the house[SAD]( We'll be sitting on it till the end of our lives!
#Person1#: That can't be. It is such a fantastic property. In such an incredibly beautiful estate. It's a matter of time.
#Person2#: That's what we thought last spring when we put it on the market.
#Person1#: It took me 2 years to sell my flat back in Poland.
#Person2#: Oh well... Wait and see. The last prospective buyers we had, 5 weeks back, were so enthusiastic we'd thought we're done. They said ours was shortlisted, their favourite in Ballito, but they still wanted to check another estate. And that was it. She didn't even bother to phone, just sent me a minimal message. Bill got so frustrated that he drank himself stiff that night.
#Person1#: He does it from time to time, doesn't he?
#Person2#: From time to time? Regularly!!! Can't you remember?!
#Person1#: Not quite. Never saw him really tight.
#Person2#: Cause you used to leave before his evening was over. I'm seriously worried about his health, to tell you the truth. It's just every day that he tipples.
#Person1#: As if slowly killing himself with liquor.
#Person2#: He doesn't care. He says he's got his life behind him.
#Person1#: But it is terrible. How can you cope with it?
#Person2#: I stopped to care too. It is his life. If he wants to put a quicker end to it, it's up to him. Look I cannot do anything about it. What hide bottles? Just don't want to have an invalid in my house one day.
#Person1#: Therapy?
#Person2#: Gimme a break! Can you imagine Bill attending an AA therapy like a good boy! I can't.
#Person1#: Nor can I.
#Person2#: We even stopped talking about his drinking problem long ago. When he started, just after and because of his early retirement, I thought I'd better refrain from commenting because he's so depressed. But then it was worse and worse... Now it's too late.
#Person1#: Poor Luisa, poor Bill. It is so sad. But you are tough Luisa. You are so incredibly tough and strong and even-tempered, I'd say.
#Person2#: Yes, I am. That keeps me sane. I don't worry if I can't change it. To a degree...
#Person1#: Right you are! "The beach scape changes every month as tides bring in tons of sand and cover the rocks making the beach appear totally different." Do you remember?
#Person2#: "Then the rocks are laid bare as the tide pulls away the sand. Such is life."
summary: #Person2# has had no luck selling her house yet. It took #Person1# 2 year to sell his apartment. Bill has a drinking problem. #Person2# has stopped trying to help Bill.

#Person3#: Ah... It's old. I don't like such books. I prefer something about love and passion.

#Person3#: Rly?

#Person3#: And then what happens?
#Person1#: He gets thrown into jail and plots revenge on the ppl who destroyed his happiness!
#Person3#: Oh my! That's interesting! I'll have to read it someday!
summary: #Person2# named his dog after one of his favorite novels, Count of Monte Chris to. #Person1# recommends the novel and #Person3# is keen to read it. She has 2 cats, Fluffy and Butters.

dialogue:
#Person1#: Hi there![HAPPY]
#Person2#: Hi, what's up?
#Person1#: Nothing much. I've heard you and Tim were apartment hunting the other day[HAPPY] You guys moving together?[HAPPY]
#Person2#: Lol, no[LAUGH]
#Person2#: He just lives super close and I thought it was a cool idea to have someone else to go with me[HAPPY]
#Person2#: The lady who owns the place actually have us a strange look[HAPPY] She looked super old fashioned so you know what she must have been thinking[LAUGH]
#Person1#: Yeah, I can imagine[HAPPY]
#Person2#: And we thought it would be funny not to explain anything. But she actually was very polite and never said anything.
#Person1#: That's a good sign actually[HAPPY]
#Person2#: Well, the flat is a typical rental, so she must have seen some stuff[HAPPY]
#Person1#: Yeah, I can imagine[HAPPY]
#Person1#: Anyway, how's the apartment?
#Person2#: Well, decent would be the best word to describe it.
#Person2#: the rooms are old, haven't been renovated in quite some time
#Person2#: The kitchen is OK - no luxurious stuff but quite nice looking. And there is a dishwasher[HAPPY]
#Person1#: Always a plus - I can't imagine living without one now[HAPPY]
#Person2#: The bathroom has been renovated recently - so it's new and in this kind of rental-basic style
#Person2#: In general, if I were buying it for myself it would need a serious overhaul, but as a rental should be ok
#Person1#: So what's stopping you? You don't seem all that enthusiastic
#Person2#: The rent is rather high so I would expect a bit more for that money
#Person1#: Well, then try to negotiate, if she's been renting it already for some time then she knows the game[HAPPY] You always set the price higher in case you find someone who would be willing to pay it[HAPPY]
#Person2#: Yeah, that's a good idea
#Person1#: And let me know how it went. Would be good to have all the gang closer[HAPPY]
#Person2#: yeah, that would be cool[HAPPY] Will let you know!
summary: Tim accompanied #Person2# with looking for the apartment the other day. They checked out one flat, which turned out to be decent, but the rent was too high. Following #Person1#'s advice, #Person2# will negotiate the rent with flat owner.

dialogue:
#Person1#: Hello Jill, my ultra-fit sister, 3 years my senior, had a heart attack early on Tuesday morning. I visited her in hospital the past 2 days and she mending well. She has had 2 stents fitted.
#Person2#: Oh Doris! So sorry! But good news she is on the mend. Miracles of medicine.
#Person1#: This has given the family a great shock as she was so well. She walked a 21 km marathon on Sunday.
#Person2#: Did she strain her heart during the walk?
#Person1#: We don't know, but there is also sign of an injury a long while ago. It worries me that there was no warning.
#Person2#: It is worrying that we can't see what's getting weaker within us. No warnings as you say. How does she take it emotionally?
#Person1#: She is quite strong.
#Person2#: Good! You too I hope?
#Person1#: Yes, absolutely.
#Person2#: Keep it up! Where is she?
#Person1#: Pietermaritzburg
#Person2#: How long do you have to drive there?
#Person1#: 1.5 hours off peak traffic.
#Person2#: Not so bad. Will you be driving to see her soon?
#Person1#: Dunno yet. Her condition is stable. She's got her husband and 3 children around her. But I may go and stay with her when she's back home.
#Person2#: To help with the household?
#Person1#: Exactly. But it may be that they'll first send her for recuperation somewhere.
#Person2#: They usually do after a serious operation, don't they?
#Person1#: That would be very good for her indeed. Also mentally. She's strong but her body may need a rest. We'll see!
#Person2#: I'll keep fingers crossed for you! Both of you.
#Person1#: Thx Jill. You never know what helps[HAPPY])
#Person2#: Take care my friend!
#Person1#: You too.
summary: #Person1#' sister had a heart attack on Tuesday and is recovering in hospital after having 2 stents fitted. Generally the sister is very fit, she walked a 21 km marathon on Sunday. She's in Pietermaritzburg, with her husband and 3 children around. #Person1# may stay with her and help once she's back home.

dialogue:
#Person1#: hey, hows your apartment search going?
#Person2#: not so good. not getting many responses.
#Person1#: i'm sorry. did you try that website I sent u?
#Person2#: yeah, i did. no luck, but i'll keep trying.
#Person1#: have you ever tried one of those websites where you can go and meet potential roommates at organized events?
#Person2#: yes, i went to a couple. I met some nice people there, but things didnt work out in the end.
#Person1#: oh man. well, I'll keep my ears open for you.
#Person2#: thanks. how are things working out at your new place?
#Person1#: good. roommates havent been here that much so Ive mostly been alone. they often go home after work or leave town for the weekend
#Person2#: i see.
#Person1#: yeah. do you want to come over and take a look at the apartment some time? I can make dinner.
#Person2#: Sure, Id love to.
#Person1#: When would be a good time?
#Person2#: I'm free thursday night.
#Person1#: OK, cool. thats a good time for me.
#Person2#: great. want me to bring anything?
#Person1#: I should be fine, thanks. Feel free to bring something to drink, but I have some wine and beer here already.
#Person2#: cool. alright, I'll see you thursday then.
#Person1#: see you then!

summary: #Person1#'s date for graduation is on June 4th. #Person2# will try to come then.

dialogue:
#Person1#: Hello, this is Beti's Mum Gita, I wanted to ask if you were going on the school trip?
#Person2#: Hi Gita, yes, Milo wants me to come, he's a bit nervous going away from home or school still.
#Person1#: Yes, Beti is the same, they are still only 4 or 5 after all.
#Person2#: I know, still so young! It will help the teachers and TAs anyway, they have a lot to cope with!
#Person1#: I know, I could never do their job! I work part time as a music teacher, going round schools.
#Person2#: Oh really? I am in Marks, part time too, love it there!
#Person1#: Yes, it really helps to do some sort of work doesn't it! I could never manage full time, though.
#Person2#: Oh, I know, Gita. My sister's in management and she doesn't see her kids from 6.30am to 6.30pm every day! She is a high flier, but she does miss them. She does do lots with them on the weekend, though.
#Person1#: Yes, but children need time to just be at home and play or just be with family, not galavanting around all the time!
#Person2#: I agree 100%! Is Beti looking forward to feeding the lambs and seeing the baby animals on the farm, Milo is very excited.
#Person1#: Oh yes! She loves animals, we have a few pets at home.
#Person2#: Well, we only have fish, they are pretty but not very interesting!
#Person1#: Suppose you're right! What time do we have to be at school on Wednesday?
#Person2#: Quite early, I think about 7.45, the bus leaves at 8 and we get to Holly Farm about 10, I think.
#Person1#: Hope the rain keeps off, especially if it's outdoors. I'll check their website.
#Person2#: Yes, good idea. Anyway, see you Weds, Gita!
#Person1#: Bye, Bev!
summary: #Person2# is going on the school trip with her son. #Person1# is going on the school trip with her daughter. #Person2#'s sister rarely sees her children during the week because of her job. #Person1# has a few pets at home. The mothers with their children have to be at school at 7.45 to not miss the bus.

dialogue:
#Person1#: Greg just texted me
#Person2#: ugh, delete him already
#Person1#: He's saying he's sorry
#Person2#: damn girl, delete the bastard
#Person1#: it's not that simple, you know it
#Person2#: No Julia, it is pretty simple
#Person2#: go and delete him
#Person1#: But he apologised, ok? He's never done it before
#Person2#: srsly?
#Person2#: do I need to remind you he cheated on you?
#Person2#: Julia I'm not going through this again with you
#Person1#: People change, I do believe it, maybe he changed. He apologised
#Person2#: and that's it? That' ok? how's different from two other times?
#Person1#: i told you - he apologised! he's sorry, he wants to meet
#Person2#: don't, honey, really. We've been through this
#Person1#: I know, but it's not easy. I think I love him
#Person2#: i know you do, but you need to be strong. do you want to come over?
#Person1#: no, thank you love, but i have to get up early tomorrow
#Person2#: ok, you should go to sleep then
#Person1#: what about Greg?
#Person2#: don't text him, he's using you, he cheated on you three times now
#Person1#: I think he has a problem, it may be a medical condition
#Person2#: a notorious twat? yeah, it might be
#Person2#: you do want what you want but remember I warned you
#Person1#: what if he‚Äôs the only guy that‚Äôll ever like me?
#Person2#: ok, now this is pure self-hating bullshit
#Person2#: don‚Äôt text him
#Person1#: putting my phone away
summary: Greg cheated on #Person1#. He apologises to her. #Person2# tells #Person1# not to meet Greg.

dialogue:
#Person1#: I broke my nail;(
#Person2#: oh, no!
#Person1#: u know I have that party tomorrow!!!
#Person2#: I know, let me think...
#Person2#: I got it!. My sister friend is a cosmetitian, maybe she 'll help
#Person1#: anyone will be good, I'm desperate!
#Person2#: I'll call her and let u know, ok?
#Person1#: ok, I'll wait, but hurry!
summary: #Person1# broke her nail and has a party tomorrow. #Person2# will call a cosmetician that she knows and let #Person1# know if she can help.

dialogue:
#Person1#: I asked them to wait and send the declaration later
#Person1#: Even end of March if it's possible
#Person2#: What did they say?
#Person1#: They want to close it asap cause Lisa is afraid she forgets about it later
#Person1#: But I can remind her in a couple of weeks
#Person1#: It's my responsibility after all
#Person2#: But does it really matter? I mean the declaration
#Person2#: I think the deadline for payment is 31 March anyway
#Person1#: I'm not sure, that's what I asked her
#Person1#: Hope she confirms
summary: #Person1# wants to have the declaration sent later. Lisa wants to send it soon. The deadline for payment is 31 March.
